title.value: The State of Artificial Intelligence in Pediatric Surgery: A Systematic Review
title.justification: The title directly indicates the paper's main focus and scope.
title.quote: The State of Artificial Intelligence in Pediatric Surgery: A Systematic Review

extractions.description: This paper systematically reviews the use of artificial intelligence (AI) in pediatric surgery, focusing on the development, validation, and application of AI models in this field. It analyzes the types of AI models reported in literature, their purposes, types, performance, validation, and interpretability, highlighting challenges such as bias and issues with applicability.

type.justification: The paper conducts a systematic review which involves the empirical analysis of multiple studies to gather insights into AI applications in pediatric surgery.
type.quote: This systematic review details the use of AI in pediatric surgery.

name.justification: The paper focuses on the use of AI models in improving pediatric surgical outcomes, representing the field of AI within healthcare.
name.quote: AI has demonstrated significant utility in healthcare...

name.justification: The paper specifically targets AI applications within pediatric surgery.
name.quote: AI in pediatric surgery remains largely unexplored...

name.justification: The models discussed are predominantly machine learning models applied within healthcare to predict outcomes and support decisions.
name.quote: Machine learning models have the ability to discover complex non-linear relationships from large volumes of data.

name.justification: Computer vision, a subset of AI involved in analyzing visual inputs, is highlighted as a major method in these applications.
name.quote: Computer vision models analyzed radiology images...

name.justification: Neural networks were widely used in the studies discussed to predict various outcomes and support surgical decisions.
name.quote: Neural networks (algorithms of interconnected nodes or “neurons” that can learn complex linear and non-linear relationships) are increasingly being used.

is_contributed.justification: The paper reviews existing use of neural networks rather than contributing a new model.
is_contributed.quote: Neural networks... are increasingly being used.

is_executed.justification: The execution details on CPU or GPU for the reviewed models aren't typically discussed in systematic reviews.
is_executed.quote: The scope of artificial intelligence applications... AI is still in its infancy.

is_compared.justification: The paper mentions comparing neural network models with other models for performance evaluation.
is_compared.quote: Most models were compared based on metrics such as AUROC, accuracy, etc.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Specific referenced papers for neural networks aren't detailed in this summary.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Neural networks... are increasingly being used.

name.justification: Ensemble learners are frequently mentioned as a commonly used AI technique in the paper.
name.quote: Neural networks (42%), and ensemble learners (44%) were the most commonly used AI techniques across subspecialties.

is_contributed.justification: The paper reviews the use of ensemble learners in existing studies rather than proposing a new one.
is_contributed.quote: Neural networks (42%), and ensemble learners (44%) were the most commonly used AI techniques.

is_executed.justification: The execution on a specific hardware isn't discussed as the review covers multiple studies with varying setups.
is_executed.quote: The scope of artificial intelligence applications... AI is still in its infancy.

is_compared.justification: Ensemble learners are mentioned alongside other AI models, highlighting their comparative role.
is_compared.quote: Most models were compared based on metrics such as AUROC, accuracy, etc.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Specific papers with title for ensemble learners are not identified in the text summary.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Neural networks (42%), and ensemble learners (44%) were the most commonly used AI techniques.

name.justification: SVM is mentioned as one of the methods used in the pediatric surgery AI models.
name.quote: The use of support vector machines was also encountered in neurosurgery for predicting surgical epilepsy outcomes.

is_contributed.justification: The paper reviews the use of support vector machines in existing studies rather than proposing a new model.
is_contributed.quote: The use of support vector machines was also encountered in...

is_executed.justification: As a review, this information is typically not included in the findings but rather discussed abstractly as model categories.
is_executed.quote: This systematic review details the use of AI in pediatric surgery.

is_compared.justification: SVMs are listed among different techniques, implying comparison among methods.
is_compared.quote: Models were cross-validated, internally validated, externally validated, or not validated.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Specific referenced paper titles for SVMs aren't identified in the systematic review format.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The use of support vector machines was also encountered in...

name.justification: The paper uses a random forest model for imputing missing performance metrics, indicating its role as a model.
name.quote: Missing performance metrics were imputed using a random forest model.

is_contributed.justification: The method is used for data preparation and analysis rather than as a primary contribution.
is_contributed.quote: Missing performance metrics were imputed using a random forest model.

is_executed.justification: As a data analysis tool, the execution on specific hardware isn't typically discussed for random forest models in systematic reviews.
is_executed.quote: Missing performance metrics were imputed using a random forest model.

is_compared.justification: It implies Random Forest over other imputation methods.
is_compared.quote: Missing performance metrics were imputed using a random forest model, which is capable of handling... effectively.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Random Forest as a known method doesn't specify reference papers within such a review.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Missing performance metrics were imputed using a random forest model.
